inn1.comm: too full and sliding onto the pads, a real warm-up ball, which is clipped away fine on the leg side. Mpofu hobbles on his followthrough and walks back gingerly
fullish, tight line on off. Hafeez presses forward and nudges it gently to mid-on
pitched up and swinging away outside off, Hafeez gets forward and shoulders arms
neatly played... He was helped by the bowler, though. Too full and straight, Hafeez leans across and flicks it to the right of mid-on for the first four of the day
pitched further up and on off, holds its line. Forward and driven to the man at short cover
veering onto the pads with a tag 'help yourself'. Hafeez chips it in the gap between midwicket and mid-on. This time, the result is three
back of a length, angled in on middle, helped away to long leg. Inauspicious start - no-ball.
Boom goes Azhar Ali! Full and wide outside off, Azhar Ali bends his knee, has a crack at it and kitchen-sinks it over extra-cover for a one-bounce four
Panyangara promptly drags his length back and tucks Azhar up, blocked back
shortish and on off as Azhar shimmies across and comes down the track. Quietly defended back to the bowler again
on a good length and zipping through outside off, Azhar protects his off stump and does the leaving dance
back of a length and on off, worked to the right of short midwicket
back of a length and curls in, Azhar shimmies across in a bid to clip it away. But does not connect. The ball wanders away to the leg side off the thigh
good length and straight in line, tapped to midwicket
pitched up and just a shade outside off, drags Hafeez forward into a drive. Check-pushed to mid-off
far too full on middle and leg, Hafeez is just too good with the flick, though he took the aerial route this time. Placed wide of midwicket
good length ball attacking off, Hafeez's straight bat intervenes
fuller and outside off, stops on Hafeez. Makes me suspect that it was a change-up; offcutter. Dabbed belatedly to point
pitched up and on off, forward and patted back to the bowler
full and angled in just outside off, Azhar shuffles across before ignoring it
back of a length and on off as Azhar walks at the bowler. His flick finds short midwicket
back of a length and on the stumps, punched down the ground. Mid-on dives to his left and cuts it off
pitched up and exploring the channel outside off, no stroke offered
Hafeez chips down the track, Panyangara straightens this good length offering outside off. Push and a miss, beaten soundly
pitched up and just outside off, pressed to short cover
back of a length and outside off, punched to the left of short cover for none
stray ball slipping down leg, glanced behind square on the leg side
back of a length and holds its line outside off, Azhar Ali walks at the bowler, gets into a tangle but adjusts and pokes it out behind point
flicked from off stump straight to mid-on. Hit sweetly but Hafeez could have placed it better
short and punished. Fractionally short and sits up outside off, Hafeez swivels on the back foot and pulls it past midwicket. He punches gloves with his captain
good length on off, flicked away to the leg side
good length ball on middle and leg, nudged in front of mid-on for a speedy single. Hafeez puts in a full-length dive, the throw wasn't direct, though
dug in on a shortish length and outside off, punched towards mid-off
good length and on a fourth-stump line, defensively pushed down the ground
pitched up and outside off, steered to third man for one. The bowler had collapsed in his followthrough but no harm done
fuller and on off, brings Hafeez on the front foot. Tapped to mid-on
kicks up from a back of a length outside off, Hafeez rides the bounce and directs it to backward point
nice and full outside off, Azhar does not bother with it
flat six for Azhar. Width on offer outside off as the bowler pulled his length back as Azhar walked at the bowler. He flexed his muscles and slashed it over point
soft hands does the trick now! Back of a length and outside off, dabbed away past a diving short third man. Who said 'Azhar is struggling'?
pitched up and stops on the batsman, off-stump line, patted towards point
back of a length and outside off, guided to point
back of a length and outside off, punched out crisply to sweeper cover
good length and comes in on off, Azhar strides forward for a push and manages an inside edge onto the pad
Azhar walks at the bowler again, this has been a regular feature of his innings in ODIs - he takes it from off stump and wrists it behind square on the leg side
back of a length and outside off, Hafeez leans back and punches it to point with an open face
looks like the change-up. Slower and outside off, Hafeez now gives the charge, adjusts and glides it to third man
Panyangara shortens his length outside off, ignored
Azhar runs down the track again. Panyangara slips in a short ball outside off, which is helped down to third man off the face of the bat
good length delivery on off, forward and tapped to mid-off
good length and outside off, punched to the right of deep third man. Coventry runs across and tidies up in the deep
fuller and on middle and off, tight line, Azhar nearly lobbed it back to the bowler after making a mess of a flick

shortish and just a shade outside off as Azhar comes down the track. He turns this towards mid-on. The fielder fails to effect a direct hit. Azhar had lost his bat but managed to make his ground in the nick of time
pitched up and outside off, driven in front of mid-off for a speedy one
dug in short and outside off, punched solidly to the covers
fuller and on off, Azhar comes on the front foot as he drives it back to the bowler
shortish and outside off, he leans back, gets on top of the bounce and punches it towards backward point
length ball outside off, steered away towards deep third man. Fifty partnership.. Another strong platform laid
half-volley outside off, he leans forward and drives it to the covers, finds the fielder
good length and outside off, mishit drive to the left of the bowler towards mid-off
good length on off, Hafeez twirls his wrists and flicks it to the right of midwicket for a couple
pitched further up and outside off, encourages the drive. Azhar plays and finds mid-off
Azhar runs at the bowler, Chibhabha shortens it as he is wary of it, punched down the ground. Azhar ponders over a single but decides against it
back of a length and on off, chopped to the right of the keeper
Azhar advances down the track and pushes this shortish ball to mid-on for a hustled single. Zimbabwe needed a direct hit there. Azhar slides his bat in for one
tucked behind square on the leg side as this was straight in line
change-up, hoodwinks Azhar. Pitched up and slower outside off, he reaches out for the drive and is beaten. Azhar was way too early into the shot
flat legbreak outside off, Hafeez goes on the back foot and cuts to point
floated up generously outside off, forward and driven to the covers
tossed up and full on middle, pushed down to long-off for oh-so-easy single
flat and quick on off, punched off the back foot to the off-side sweeper
a bit leg-stumpish, Hafeez sinks to one knee and sweeps it to square leg, who makes a half-stop, diving to his left
plenty of width on offer and Hafeez takes toll of it as he nails a cut past the man at backward point
on a length and outside off, pushed to the man at covers
Azhar nips down the track, Chibhabha bangs it short. Azhar dispatches it over midwicket for a one-bounce four. Strong pull...
short ball, down leg, put away. Yikes, Azhar misses out on it as he helps it straight to the man at 45
length and outside off, guided to third man with an angled bat
good length and on off, knocked down the ground to long-on
beats mid-off to his left! Chibhabha attempts a slower ball and floats it up outside off, near half-volley. Azhar reaps benefits thanks to a wristy drive
looped up and spins away outside off, forward and eased to sweeper cover
pitched up on off, Azhar lunges forward and knocks it to point
flatter and quicker outside off, cracked away square on the off side off the back foot
flighted and turning away, poked out behind point
slid through, turning away, guided to short third man via an open face
flat and quick outside off, he cuts but can't bisect short third and backward point
too full and on off, Hafeez flicks it to the left of midwicket but long-on mops up in the deep
Chibhabha drifts a slower ball down the leg side. Azhar was perhaps early into the glance and did not connect
back of a length and on middle, Azhar prods across and blocks to leg
good length around off, Azhar steps down the track and clips a single behind square leg
good length and outside off, Hafeez drops it into the gap to the right of covers. Mid-off has it covered
floated up on off, he lunges forward for an off-drive and skews it to long-on off the inner half of the bat
takes it from off stump and flips his wrists through midwicket
looped up outside off, Hafeez races down the track, does not meet the pitch of the ball and drags it to long-on
quick outside off, flat in trajectory, cut away to deep backward point
pitched up and on off, pushed back to the bowler, who dives to his left in the followthrough and stops the ball
rides the bounce outside off and late-cuts it past backward point, short third man hunts it down to his right
flat and fired on off, pushed back to Creamer off the back foot
pitched around leg and drifting down as Hafeez sinks low to one knee and does not connect with the attempted sweep
picked away off the pads behind square on the leg side
leg-stumpish line again, tucked to the right of midwicket
back of a length and on off, Azhar punchily drives it, rather mishits it back to the bowler
pushed straight down the ground, the bowler stretches his right hand and deflects it past Hafeez towards mid-on
dug in short and outside off, Hafeez loads up for a pull over midwicket. He does not time it properly as he ends up dragging it to cow corner
shortish, top-of-off line, Hafeez bends back and late-cuts it to deep third man
flat and turning away outside off, cut to backward point

connects with the pull and takes four! Dropped short, Hafeez rocks back and sends it to the cow corner boundary. Sibanda runs across to his left from deep midwicket, dives and gets a hand to it but can't quite haul it in
flatter and outside off, cut well but can't pierce the packed off-side ring
shorter in length and his cut picks the gap in the off side
looped up, eased to sweeper cover
Creamer gives this more air and gets it to turn away. Dabbed with soft hands to short third man
Hafeez reaches fifty first. Azhar walks up and congratulates the Professor. Back of a length and outside off, back-cut past backward point for a couple
shortish and widish outside off, cut away to the right of deep third man. Another landmark - 100 partnership
length and outside off, pushed to the covers
short and punished, deep midwicket has no chance. You can't afford to hit that length with such friendly pace. The Professor swivels on the back foot and pulls it behind square
much tighter.. Good length and on off, he prods forward and presses it to the covers
dug in shortish and outside off, Hafeez rides it to the right of deep third man. It has been a productive area for the hosts
low full toss and hammered. Hafeez sinks to one knee and pastes a slog-sweep over deep midwicket. Creamer over-corrected and paid the penalty
turning away, flat, slapped past the covers
on a length and spinning away, played to backward point
full on middle and leg, semi-driven and semi-clipped down to long-on
up and over short cover. Pitched up and slower through the air on off, deliberately chipped over Kaia

a direct hit and they go to the TV umpire. This looks close. Azhar has to depart. No fifty for the Pakistan captain. Flighted on off, Hafeez presses it in front of cover and takes off for a risky single. Azhar responds but is caught short by an accurate throw. Perhaps, Azhar could have put in a dive. Sharp work from Raza as he swooped down on the ball..
tossed up on off, nudged to leg
flighted and outside off, down the track and lifted over vacant mid-off. There is protection in the deep, on the bounce to the fielder
angled in on off, defended with bat and pad close together
slid through short and outside off, slapped through cover-point to sweeper
tucked away off the pads to midwicket. They don't take on Raza's arm
arm-ball on middle, knocked to midwicket. This time, they take on Raza's arm and steal a single
quick and outside off, cut away to deep point
flighted on middle, pressed to the covers
flighted and full outside off, lunge forward and driven to the covers
full on off, driven to mid-off
flat and turning away, chopped to the covers
full on middle and leg, worked in front of midwicket
pitched up on off, driven down to long-off
tucked to midwicket off a straight line
down the track and pushed back to the bowler. Hafeez did not quite meet the pitch of the ball
flicked to the right of midwicket. Raza I guess dives to his right and makes a half-save

lands in front of long-on. Darted short and just outside off, Hafeez has to fetch the pull from there, mishits it. Chibhabha runs in from long-on, hurls himself forward and grabs it on the bounce. It had fallen short of him
another dive, this time from the bowler in his followthrough. Williams dives to his left and stops the push
flighted on middle, defended
width on offer outside off, Hafeez bends his knee and cracks it away to the deep backward point boundary. Panyangara slides in the deep at the edge of the boundary but can only deflect it away
fuller and around off, pushed to the covers
dropped shortish and outside off, Hafeez leans back and cuts to point
swept away firmly... Leg-stumpish line, Hafeez rolls his wrists on the sweep and sends it behind square leg
flat legbreak, Hafeez pushes off the back foot and gets an inside edge back to the bowler
Shafiq skips out and yorks himself. Jabs his bat down and keeps it out
angled in flat on middle, pulled past midwicket to cow corner
darted short and wide outside off, Shafiq reaches out and guides it to short third man
comes down the track, manufactures a full-toss and bunts it to long-on
Hafeez makes a trip down the track, Williams shortens his length. Defended to the covers
back of a length on off, punchily played to the covers for a quick one

Raza strikes first ball, Ahsan Raza's forefinger goes up. Hafeez isn't happy, he shakes his head as he walks back. This was angled in flat and straight from round the stumps, Hafeez does not connect with the flick. Rapped on the back pad in front of middle and leg.
fuller and outside off, he secures a single down to long-on
picked away off the pads backward of square leg
on the pads again, glanced to short fine leg
flat and outside off, punched down to long-off off the back foot
fired on middle and leg, swept away towards deep midwicket
flat on middle, jabbed defensively to leg
short and wide outside off, cut to the off-side sweeper
good length on off, defended
down the track, yorks himself. Dug out back to the bowler
flat and fired on middle and leg, defended
pitched up and outside off, eased down to long-off
punched down to long-on
on a length and on middle and leg, jabbed to midwicket
dropped short and wide outside off, he loads up, leans back and cuts away in the gap at the covers. Sped away to the boundary
down the track and driven past the bowler to long-on
picked away off the pads in front of square on the leg side
drifts this one on middle and leg, nudged behind square leg
darted flat on middle, swept away to deep backward square leg
defended to cover in front of off stump
fullish on off, pressed to the covers, Sibanda is quick onto the ball
flat on off, Shafiq goes back and flicks to midwicket
full and just outside off, driven smoothy to long-off
slid through on off, driven to the covers. The fielder dives to his left and unfurls a one-handed stop
slid through outside off, cut and miss
nurdled off the pads behind square leg
angled on middle and leg, Shafiq comes down the track, fails to get to the pitch of the ball and takes it on the pad

Shafiq falls. Soft as wax. This was tossed up on the leg stump, nothing striking about the delivery. Shafiq shapes to flick, instead he chips it tamely to midwicket, where Williams takes it in front of his face
fired flat and outside off, punched to cover
tucked to midwicket
quicker on middle, glanced to short fine leg
flatter on middle and leg, nudged to midwicket
darted on middle, clipped in front of square on the leg side
much flatter on off as Azam skips out. Adjusts and blocks it
now he keeps in the crease and secures a single to long-on
pushed off the back foot to the covers
flatter and outside off, cut off the back foot to cover-point. Diving save keeps it to one
fired on middle, Malik stands tall and punches to long-on
darted on the pads, helped straight to short fine leg
length and outside off, punchily driven to mid-off

on the pads, picked away in front of square on the leg side. Malik wants two and puts himself in trouble. Terrific throw and another run out, Malik has to go. He is short of the crease, he swipes his bat in the air as he trudges back. Mpofu runs across to his left from deep backward square leg, collects the ball even as he loses balance. Lets rip a flat, good throw to Mutumbami, who does the rest
full and on middle, driven confidently to long-on
cut off the back foot to point
straight ball on middle, blocked
quicker and outside off, Sarfraz slashes and gets a four past the man at slip. Runs away off an outer edge
flighted on off, drop-and-run in front of the covers
flatter on off, down the track, not to the pitch of the ball and pushed back to the bowler
flatter length on and around off, he goes deep in the crease and cracks it away towards deep point
fired down leg, no shot offered
straight ball, clipped through midwicket
flicked off the pads behind square leg
whipped with the wrists to deep midwicket
fullish and outside off, Sarfraz gets forward and eases it to the covers
back of a length and on middle, punched back at Raza
slid through on off, Sarfraz makes room and cuts to cover-point
Babar shows his ace early as he steps down the track. Williams drags his length back, defended
tapped to sweeper cover
bunted down to long-on
full and straight, whippily driven to long-on
Sarfraz waits on this flat ball and turns it to the right of Raza at midwicket. He gives the chase and tidies up
dug in short and outside off, he shifts his balance onto the back foot and punches it to sweeper cover
sliding onto the pads, worked through backward square leg
Sarfraz steps away outside leg, Raza chases with a full ball. Drilled to long-on
slid down leg, Mutumbai takes the bails off but Babar was in
driven smoothly to long-on was this was fuller on off
Sarfraz brings out his favorite shot and takes four. Full and on middle and leg, swept away to the right of deep backward square leg
Sarfraz makes room outside leg, gets a full toss and pushes it straight to mid-off
he skips away outside leg again, Raza is on his toes and that's pushed to mid-off again
arm-ball, raps Sarfraz on the pad. Pitched outside leg, though
slid through on the leg stump, Sarfraz goes low and sweeps it, finds backward square leg
down the track, almost yorks himself but manages a single to mid-off
turned through midwicket from a middle-and-leg line. Sarfraz hares across for the second. Positive batting
Williams loses his radar and errs down leg
full and straight on middle, mistimed drive back to the bowler off the inside half of the bat after stepping away
looks like a low full toss, dips in. Driven to wide long-on
Sarfraz makes room outside leg, Raza fires it wider down leg
superb connection.. Sarfraz makes room outside leg again, he pitches it short. Pulled away between deep square and deep midwicket
on a length and the bowler holds this one back. Check-pushed to the off side

Raza gets his third, Sarfraz's cameo is over. Tossed up on middle, Sarfraz wants to whip it away over midwicket. His timing is not all that good as he just scoops it to Williams there. Nice, low catch..
flat on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
nudged to the right of the bowler
angled on the pads, swept past short fine  leg to deep backward square leg
straight ball, too full on middle, jammed back to the bowler
nudged through midwicket as this was full and straight again
quick and down leg, Babar manages a scintilla of tickle fine on the leg side, beats the keeper to his left for his first four in ODIs
darted on the leg stump, he misses the flick and takes it on the pad
down the track and dropped in the gap at off side for a speedy single. Alert running between the wickets
flat and on the pads, blocked to the right of the bowler, towards short midwicket area. They take a single by the time Williams gets to the ball and attempts a throw at the non-strikers'
Hammad makes room outside leg and misses the slog-sweep as Raza follows him. Hit on the pad
push and run to the covers for one. The fielder helped Pakistan's cause with a misfield
down the track and clips this straight ball to midwicket
dropped short and on middle and leg, he rocks back and short-arm pulls it to the right of the square leg umpire
flat on off, he nips down the track and secures a single to mid-off
closes the face of the bat early on the flick and gets a leading edge in front of mid-off
flighted on middle, knocked gently in front of square leg for one
loopy legbreak, spins away, poked out towards point after prodding forward
full on off, pushed back with firm hands
bowled'em. Tossed up generously, Hammad clears his front leg, winds up for a cross-bat swipe but misses it entirely. Creamer nails middle and leg
drifting onto the leg stump, nudged in front of midwicket
flat on middle, whipped through midwicket
fired outside off, skips back and cuts it straight to cover-point
flat and quick, blocked
makes room outside leg, follows the batsman with a short ball. Babar ventures deep in the crease and hits a pull to the left of deep midwicket. The fielder runs across and his dive proves futile
eased down to long-off for one
defended in front of the off stump
flat and fired on off, punched to the covers for a hustled single
looped up on off, pushed back to the bowler
flighted on middle, googly. Dropped to the leg side for one

looped up on off, he caresses a lofted-drive over the covers. Sibanda runs across perhaps from long-off to his left but the ball beats him. Gorgeous timing and a high elbow on display. I guess there was a sense of pride in that Babar Azam strike
slider, chopped to the covers
Creamer loops it up and gives it ample air outside off, creamed to deep cover. Coventry slides in the deep and keeps it to three
tucked towards cow corner off the back foot
leg-side wide
pushed through on off, driven towards the covers
straight roller on middle, nudged through midwicket
darted flat on middle, he rocks back and pulls it to deep midwicket
tossed up and outside off, stops on the batsman. Chipped in front of mid-off
pressed behind point for a single
low full toss outside off is duly dispatched.. Slapped away to the left of the covers
lobbed up on off, driven to long-off
picked away off the back foot through midwicket as this was slower through the air on off
flighted and outside off, eased to sweeper cover. Babar seeks another but is wisely sent back by Anwar
wristed to the right of the bowler off the off stump. The bowler intercepts the ball with his boot
fifty on debut for Babar. He raises his bat and acknowledges the cheers. Anwar congratulates Babar. Milks a single to long-on
pushed through on middle and leg, Anwar misses the sweep and wears it on the pad but this was snaking down the leg side
dug in on a back of a length and on off, glided to deep third man
shortish and outside off, steered to third man
down the track and flat-bats this shorter one to the covers
back of a length and outside off, skelped in the air to sweeper cover
clears long-on! Change of pace from Panyangara. Anwar Ali gets forward, checks his lofted stroke and hits it over long-on
back of a length and on off, he employs soft hands and drops it in front of the covers for one
fired full and dips in on off, almost a yorker, which is dug out towards mid-on
slower ball sprayed wide outside off. He shuffles across off, swings and misses
has Babar nicked off? Umpire Riffin shakes his head. Yorker outside off, he jabs his bat down and gets a healthy nick to the keeper. Tiffin did not spot it
fuller and just outside off, he swings and skews it in the air. The ball drops into no-man's land between long-on and long-off

Mpofu looks skywards, stretches his arms and celebrates. Full toss on off, Babar shuffles across and aims to whip-slog to the leg side. He only manages a thick inside edge onto the off stump. Nevertheless, it was an impressive innings on debut
veering down leg, tickled between the keeper and short fine leg. Bad line from Mpofu. No bat involved, given as leg-byes

dug in shortish and outside off, dabbed to backward point for a speedy one. The fielder (Chibhabha) has a shy at the bowler's end but misses the direct hit. A direct hit would have sent Wahab back. Perhaps, the bowler could have backed up as well.
back of a length and on off, pushed back to the bowler off the back foot
heaves the short one from outside off to long-on
banged in shortish and rises on middle, Anwar shuffles across off, half-swings and half-pulls to deep backward square leg
low full toss outside off, backs away and scythes it to mid-off
low full toss on off as Panyangara makes a mess of the yorker. Anwar gets under it and smites it over long-on
pushed too full and outside off, Anwar loads up, blows up and drills it to long-off; Panyangara finger-tipped it away

thats a skier and out of reach of the three fielders who converge on it. Full and outside off, slower in pace, he makes room and scythes it over backward point. Chamu Chibhabha pulls it back after running across from deep third man
swipes and misses a slower, short ball outside off
third straight slower one. This one is a bouncer, Wahab is early into the pull and misses
That exploded from the meat of the bat. Banged in short and on off, Wahab winds up and swings it over deep midwicket
one-bounce four and beats long-off to his left. Full and outside off, too full. Wahab sinks to one knee and pastes it over extra-cover

another slower ball and Wahab edges it to the keeper. Mpofu blows a kiss skywards. Dug in short and wide outside off, Wahab backs away but can't carve it away. He can only feed an outside edge to Mutumbami
low full toss outside off, Anwar throws his bat at it and slices it in the gap, bisection short third man and backward point. Panyangara misses the yorker and pays the penalty

Yasir has been run out, the TV umpire confirms it... Impressive, flat throw from Raza. Another low full toss, mishit to long-on. Raza runs forward, attacks the ball and fires the throw to Panyangara, who collects the ball and tips the bails off, catching Yasir a couple of yards short on the second run. Yasir: 0 off 0 balls
Panyangara does not meet with a yorker, another full toss, drilled to long-off. Just one
good length, slower cutter outside off, steered to the covers
banged in short and rises outside off, Anwar Ali shuffles across and slogs it to deep midwicket for  single
Junaid finishes off with a one-bounce four. Dug in short, Junaid goes deep in the crease and mows it over midwicket

inn2.comm: back of a length on middle, maneuvered behind square on the leg side

good length and on middle, tucked to short midwicket for one. The fielder (Malik) swoops down on the ball and misses the direct hit at the non-strikers'. Two fielders converge on the ball but the ball eludes both and runs away to the boundary. Chibhabha gets off the mark with five as the umpire got in way of the fielders. Junaid too could't get back near the stumps in time
back of a length and around off, defensively pushed to the covers
much fuller and around off, tapped to mid-off off the front foot
hurled in on middle, blocked
back of a length and on middle, worked to Malik at short midwicket
full and holds its line on off, forward and pushed to mid-off
good length and on off, Chibhabha prods across off and turns it to midwicket
back of a length and on off, punchily defended back to the bowler
similar length and outside off, punched down the track, bisecting mid-on and mid-off. Azhar and Wahab nearly collided
too full and on middle and leg, Chibhabha twirls his wrists and places it between midwicket and mid-on

back of a length and rises on off, clipped away in front of square on the leg side for three runs. Chibhabha bringing his wrists to play again. Hafeez was pretty good with the flick early in the first innings
back of a length and on off, Chibhabha keeps back and blocks to mid-on
fullish and outside off, Chibhabha shuffles across and manages an inside edge onto the pad to weather the lbw appeal. He did not get hold of the flick
back of a length inducker from Junaid, Sibanda looks to chop it away and manages an inside edge that bounces onto the turf and lobs over the stumps
down the track, hurled in on off. Carefully defended to the covers
good length and on middle, down the track and dragged in front of mid-on. It just lands in front of the fielder, who had got his body behind it to half-stop the ball
low full toss on off, scooped in front of short cover
back of a length and width on offer, cracked away to the right of deep third man off the front foot. Excellent strike
good length, bends in on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
banged in short and outside off as he steps out. Sibanda adjusts and pumps it over backward point with a sliced hit
back of a length and outside off, steps down the track and punches it up and over short cover, skips away to the left of mid-off. Azhar gives the chase and limits it to three
back of a length and outside off, punched in the gap between two. But extra-cover denies them one
length and outside off, Chibhabha reaches out for a drive and runs it to third man off a thick outer edge
darted on the pads and banished to the boundary. Sibanda closes his bat face and clips it between midwicket and mid-on. Don't bother chasing that Azhar
shortish and climbs on middle, Sibanda shuffles across off and nurdles a single in front of square on the leg side
skiddy short ball on middle, late onto the flick, gets it to the leg side off the inner half of the bat
back of a length and on middle, wristed to the right of midwicket. The throw is off radar and they pick three
banged in short and outside off from round the stumps as he comes down the track. Sibanda yanks his head out of the way and lets that pass
good length and around off, goes on the back foot and whips it between midwicket and mid-on. Precise placement and the timing was equally good
short and tucks up Chibhabha for room. Has Chibhabha hopping straightaway. Fended to the leg side
shortish and outside off, Sibanda takes it from outside off and neatly flicks it through midwicket
keeps it short on middle and leg, worked to midwicket for none. Yikes, they steal a single off an overthrow at the non-strikers'
dug in on a back of a length and outside off, punched behind point. Third man runs across to his right to mop that up in the deep
back of a length and on middle, he camps back and blocks it to midwicket
good length and on off, forward and clipped to mid-on
fullish and just outside off, clipped to long-on
pitched up on off, worked to midwicket. The fielder dives to his right and fumbles
slower through the air on middle and leg, tucked in front of square on the leg side
low full toss on middle, dips in late, helped down to long-on
looped up on middle, turned straight to midwicket
lobbed up again, spins in on middle, nudged to backward square leg
back of a length and angling away, punched out to point

pinged on the middle of the helmet! Ripper of a bouncer with enough legs on it, he was late onto the pull or perhaps caught between pulling and leaving. He is struck on the helmet. He took his eyes off it and the ball dribbles behind square leg. Sibanda had taken a couple of paces forward but could not connect. Neither could he get out of the way
pacy indipper from Wahab, he is late onto the push and manages an inside edge that evades the stumps and wanders away behind square leg
length ball and outside off, he waits for the ball to come onto him and crunches it past the covers. Gorgeous hit from Chibhabha
back of a length, shuffles across off and blocks it back to the bowler
change-up. Back of a length and Wahab pulls the pace off this outside off. Steered to point
fuller ball, eased down to long-on for one
picked away behind square leg for a brace
worked to midwicket
flighted and outside off, pushed back to the bowler
looped up generously, blocked
tucked through square leg for a couple of runs. Good running between the wickets.
